subject: RE: [junit] time overhead
msgSnippet: Isn t the whole point that there is no overhead in Test First. You still have to write the tests if you test after. It s just that you re able to test *while*
messageBody:
Isn't the whole point that there is no overhead in Test First. You still
have to write the tests if you test after. It's just that you're able to
test *while* coding : I won't list the benefits as they are quite well
documented..
joe

> -----Original Message-----
> From: infosuresh@... [mailto:infosuresh@...]
> Sent: 06 February 2002 10:39
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com; Carniel Frederic
> Subject: Re: [junit] time overhead
>
>
>
> hi,
> I too tried too sell the same idea. Initially, they were
> hesitant but I convinced them to use it once. Initially it
> may look as if its consuming time.
>
> After using it once, they realised that lot of time is saved
> in debugging .
>
> regards
> Suresh
>
> Carniel Frederic <frederic.carniel@...>:
>
> > I tried to sell test first approch on java in my companie with junit
> > and
> > other tools for servlet testing (we use tomcat and sun jdk).
> > The main question is :
> > What is the overhead of time for coding test first ?
> > Does someone know some comparaison document on time coding between
> > standard
> > coding and test first coding ?
> > Could you give me a feed back of your experience?
> > does it take more time or the same time ?
> >
> > Thank you
> >
> > Fr�d�ric CARNIEL
> >
